commentary.line: We are one match away from the final. MUM have already qualified and will be eager to find out who they will be facing at Eden Gardens on the 24th. CHN and BLR lock horns one more time this season, Chennai have had the better of Bangalore in the league stage. Will they keep it that way? Join us on Friday to find out. Until then, take care and Cya!
Below are some of the best tweets pertaining to this game...
Sarang Bhalerao: RAJ were in the game for the first 14 overs. From there on AB and Mandeep played gems and took the game away from #RAJ #BLRvsRAJ
Broken Cricket: So It will be: India's Test Captain VS India's ODI Captain at Ranchi on Friday. To meet India's Talent in Finals!!
Gaurav Khalra: royal thrashing from royal to royals #BLRvsRAJ
Boria Majumdar: Comprehensive win for BLR. @ABdeVilliers17 proved how good a player he is. From 60 in 10 to 180 was brilliant. Good game set up vs CHN.
Harini Rana: Oh #RAJ after a phenomenal season #IPL8 this wasn't the way to bow out. Completely outplayed #Pune by a very focussed and dangerous #BLR

ABD: "I didn't perform that well in the last couple of innings. So, pretty hard on myself, happy that I got few runs today. I honestly don't know how we got to 180 when I was walking back after I got out. I was communicating with the boys and was looking at 140. The way Mandeep Singh played today, it is a man of the match performance, this trophy is going to him. There are no easy games in the IPL, CHN is a world class team and have won plenty of tournaments. For now, going to enjoy a beer with the boys."
AB de Villiers is the Man of the Match for his 38-ball 66.

Kohli: "Absolutely, it is just a semifinal for now. It was great to come across today. We know AB is the best batsman in the world, but that youngster (Mandeep) showed how special he is today and why we pulled him from Punjab. At one stage, after 7 overs I thought we should have bowled first. He (Starc) is good, the ground is a bit soft, even I am a bit stiff in the legs. He is fit and fine and he was just going through the motions towards the end. It was a great effort by the bowlers. This year we have played better cricket than the previous seasons. We have won crucial games, boys standing up and delivering for the team. A month and a half of good cricket and now it comes down to this."

Smith: "A fair bit went wrong for us tonight. We started well with the ball, but lost it in the middle. AB and Mandeep took the game away from us. I thought 160 was a par score, they got bit more than that. We did have a good start to the tournament, but T20 is like that, we got into a bit of roll, but lost the momentum towards the end."

Earlier, de Villiers and Mandeep helped BLR to make a smart recovery after they lost the wickets of Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli. Both of them played a flurry of sparkling shots and cracked fifties. On the other hand, RAJ's bowlers let the team down by losing the plot in the slog overs.

After AB de Villiers and Mandeep Singh composed eye-catching knocks, BLR's bowlers put up a disciplined show to register a convincing win. With this comprehensive victory, BLR next will take on CHN in Qualifier 2 at Ranchi. While chasing down a sizeable target, RAJ struggled to string together partnerships as the game meandered towards a one-sided finish. Only Ajinkya Rahane played a handy innings.

Kohli is delighted as always. He quickly runs from the boundary rope to gather his team around. A fan comes running onto the ground and touches Kohli's feet. All smiles in the BLR camp as they make their way out of the middle.

18.6   Chahal to D Kulkarni, out Bowled!! BLR will take on CHN in Qualifier 2. The wrong 'un from Chahal, Kulkarni backs away to the leg-side, doesn't seem to have picked it, goes for the drive, misses and the ball crashes into middle stump. D Kulkarni b Chahal 3(9)
Chahal to D Kulkarni, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
18.5   Chahal to Ankit Sharma, 1 run, shortish and outside off, Ankit cuts it to extra cover, Mandy once again in action as he tumbles across to field the ball
18.4   Chahal to D Kulkarni, 1 run, tossed up around off, Kulkarni kneels down and slog sweeps to deep mid-wicket, Mandy moves to his left, dives and stops it on the bounce. Saved three runs there
18.3   Chahal to D Kulkarni, no run, googly that turns back in, Kulkarni knocks it to cover off the back foot
18.2   Chahal to Ankit Sharma, 1 run, floated up outside off, Ankit reaches out and slices it to sweeper cover
Gayle standing at slip
18.1   Chahal to D Kulkarni, 1 run, flighted on middle and leg, Kulkarni wrists it down to long-on
Yuzvendra Chahal [3.0-0-16-1] is back into the attack
17.6   Starc to Ankit Sharma, no run, back of a length outside off, Ankit moves across and is beaten comprehensively on the back foot defence. Not much he could do there
17.5   Starc to D Kulkarni, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Kulkarni eases it to sweeper cover for a single
17.5   Starc to D Kulkarni, wide, sprays it down leg, Kulkarni can't lay bat on ball, good take by DK as it was rising steeply
17.4   Starc to D Kulkarni, no run, banged in halfway down the wicket, Kulkarni makes room and can't connect with the cut shot
17.3   Starc to D Kulkarni, no run, fullish and around off, Kulkarni defends it to mid-off
17.2   Starc to D Kulkarni, no run, almost! A low full toss, Kulkarni is beaten for pace, plays the drive after the ball passes him, inches away from the off-pole
17.1   Starc to D Kulkarni, no run, good length ball on off from round the wicket, Kulkarni stays back and defends to cover

16.6   Wiese to Ankit Sharma, FOUR, slower delivery outside off, Ankit hangs back and hammers it to deep extra cover, Starc runs to his left, dives and allows the ball to go through. He was struggling there, doesn't seem to be a 100%
Dhawal Kulkarni, right handed bat, comes to the crease

16.5   Wiese to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Starc!! Hooda goes trying to score some runs. Short delivery at the batsman, gets a bit big on the him, Hooda goes for the pull, gets it high on the bat as it balloons to deep square, Starc runs forward and takes it comfortably. BLR one wicket away from sealing the game. Deepak Hooda c Starc b Wiese 11(14)
Wiese to Deepak Hooda, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

16.4   Wiese to Ankit Sharma, 1 run, fuller and on off, Ankit goes back and knocks it towards cover, Sarfaraz throws at the non-striker's end, he fails to hit the target, Ankit was struggling even with the dive
16.3   Wiese to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, pitched up on the stumps, Hooda drills it along the ground to long-on
16.2   Wiese to Deepak Hooda, no run, shortish and outside off, Hooda cuts and picks out backward point

16.1   Wiese to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, fullish and outside off, Hooda comes down the track and slices it to sweeper cover, the ball was in the air for some time, ABD runs in, puts in the slide but the ball lands in front of him, he does well to get some body behind it
Ankit Sharma, left handed bat, comes to the crease
David Wiese [3.0-0-24-1] is back into the attack

15.6   Starc to C Morris, out Caught by Chahal!! The end is approaching for RAJ. Morris goes without troubling the scorers. Starc picks up his first of the game. Full and on off, Morris backs away and goes for the loft over mid-off, doesn't get the elevation and offers a simple catch to Chahal. C Morris c Chahal b Starc 0(3)
Starc to C Morris, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
15.5   Starc to C Morris, no run, shortens the length as Morris gives the charge, the ball bounces a bit more and zips past the outside edge. A nothing shot that from Morris
15.4   Starc to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, fullish and angling in on off, Hooda lofts it off the inside half to long-on
Starc was seen stretching his back during the strategic break. Hopefully, it is nothing serious as BLR need him for a few more days.
15.3   Starc to Deepak Hooda, no run, again, short and cramping the batsman for room, Hooda defends off the inner part to the right of the keeper
15.2   Starc to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, short and outside off, Hooda stands tall and lifts it over extra cover for a couple
15.1   Starc to Deepak Hooda, no run, Starc starts from round the wicket, on a length just outside off, Hooda steers it straight to the fielder at backward point
Mitchell Starc [2.0-0-17-0] is back into the attack

14.6   Aravind to C Morris, no run, slanted across the right-hander, Morris plays inside the line and is beaten all ends up. Another splendid performance with the ball from Aravind, he ends with: 4-0-20-2
Chris Morris, right handed bat, comes to the crease

14.5   Aravind to Binny, out Binny Run Out!! RAJ falling apart. It was hara-kiri in the middle. Good length ball on the stumps, Binny takes a step out of the crease and misses the flick, the bowler and rest of the BLR players went up for an lbw appeal, but umpire Shamsuddin was not convinced. Meanwhile, Binny wanted the run and was halfway down the wicket before Hooda sent him back, the ball rolled towards point, Chahal gets to the ball and throws it to DK, who whips the bails off and catches Binny short of the crease. Binny run out (Chahal/D Karthik) 0(1)
Aravind to Binny, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!
Stuart Binny, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Third umpire called in for a run-out check. Binny the man in question. He is struggling. OUT!

14.4   Aravind to Faulkner, out Caught&Bowled!! That might just be the game for BLR. Aravind knew straightaway that he had got Faulkner, he threw the ball up as soon as he completed the catch. It was a low full toss outside off, Faulkner goes for the heave, inside edges it onto the left boot, the ball pops up to the bowler, Aravind jumps to his left and takes it with both hands. That's an unlucky way to get out, but BLR won't mind it. Faulkner c and b Aravind 4(4) [4s-1]
Aravind to Faulkner, THATS OUT!! Caught&Bowled!!

Aravind thinks he has got his man. BLR players seem confident. The umpires are going upstairs. Has the ball hit the turf before lobbing back to Aravind? He is fine with the no-ball. It seems to have come off the boot. Faulkner is in trouble. He is OUT!
14.3   Aravind to Faulkner, no run, slower delivery angled across the right-hander, Faulkner goes for the swipe towards cow corner, misses it by a long way

14.2   Aravind to Faulkner, FOUR, poor delivery and Faulkner is off the mark. Short and on leg-stump, Faulkner swivels and pulls it over backward square, no one protecting the fence behind square. So, it was easy pickings
14.2   Aravind to Faulkner, wide, bumper on the stumps, Faulkner was winding up for the big hit, the ball is too high and is called a wide. Kohli is not happy with that decision
14.1   Aravind to Faulkner, no run, short of length around off, Faulkner dabs it towards the keeper, DK is quick to swoop in on the ball
Sreenath Aravind [3.0-0-15-1] is back into the attack
James Faulkner, right handed bat, comes to the crease

13.6   Chahal to Rahane, out Caught by de Villiers!! RAJ have lost half their side and are heading out of the tournament. Floated up around off, Rahane kneels down and plays the slog sweep, the top-edge skies towards deep mid-wicket, AB snaffles it easily. Rahane had to go for it, but unfortunately he couldn't middle it. Rahane c de Villiers b Chahal 42(39) [4s-4]
Chahal to Rahane, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
13.5   Chahal to Rahane, 2 runs, Chahal sees the batsman advances, drags the length back, punched it back to the bowler, Chahal misfields and allows the batsmen to come back for the second
13.4   Chahal to Rahane, no run, googly around off, Rahane leans forward and works it to the right of the bowler, Chahal runs across, dives and makes a half stop, the batsmen don't risk the run
13.3   Chahal to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, pushed through on the pads, nurdled away to deep square leg
13.2   Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, marginally short and outside off, Rahane cuts it towards cover-point, Wiese dives to his right and stops the ball
13.1   Chahal to Rahane, no run, nicely tossed up delivery, Rahane presses forward and blocks it to the off-side
Yuzvendra Chahal [2.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
Time-out. RAJ have to find the momentum from somewhere. Rahane has been batting for a while and they would want him to shift gears with the likes of Faulkner and Binny still waiting in the dugout.
12.6   Harshal Patel to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, another off-speed delivery, Hooda works it square of the wicket on the leg-side, comes back for the second before the ball is hunted down

12.5   Harshal Patel to Deepak Hooda, no run, slower delivery and Hooda is cut into two. The off-cutter that grips the surface, Hooda presses forward and is beaten off the inside edge. The ball was not far away from the off-pole either
12.4   Harshal Patel to Deepak Hooda, no run, well directed bouncer, Hooda shuffles across and is late on the pull, misses it by a mile

12.3   Harshal Patel to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, fuller and angling in, Hooda leans forward and chips it to the left of mid-on, Kohli gives chase from mid-off, slides and hauls it back in. Top effort from the BLR skipper, saved a couple of runs
A wide slip in place..
12.2   Harshal Patel to Deepak Hooda, no run, well that's a rare sight, at least at this stage of the innings, good length ball just outside off, Hooda lifts his bat and lets it go
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease

12.1   Harshal Patel to Nair, out Caught by D Karthik!! Harshal strikes with the first ball in his new spell. RAJ's chase is going nowhere. Back of a length delivery with a bit of extra bounce, Karun goes for the cut, the ball takes the outside edge and DK does the rest. BLR are taking control of the game. It was too close to be playing that shot. Nair c D Karthik b Harshal Patel 12(13) [4s-2]
Harshal Patel to Nair, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Harshal Patel [2.0-0-11-1] is back into the attack

11.6   Wiese to Rahane, 2 runs, tad fuller and just outside off, Rahane pushes it with soft hands towards mid-on. Mandeep runs in from long-on, but the batsmen have enough time to get back for the second run
11.5   Wiese to Nair, 1 run, short of a good length and well outside off, Karun went hard on the cut and ends up chopping it to the right of point
11.4   Wiese to Nair, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Karun was looking to drop it towards the off-side with soft hands, ends up pushing it back towards the bowler
11.3   Wiese to Nair, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Karun pushes at that, gets a thick inside edge back towards the bowler
11.2   Wiese to Rahane, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Rahane dabs it towards point for a single
11.1   Wiese to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four, this was full and just outside off, Rahane went hard on the cross batted slog, gets a thick edge, DK dives across but the ball flew past him
David Wiese [2.0-0-16-1] is back into the attack

10.6   Aravind to Nair, 2 runs, that's a stunning bit of fielding from AB, saved a couple of runs there for his team. Width on offer from Aravind, Karun cracked it past point. The ball was racing away to the fence. AB gets across from sweeper cover, puts in the dive and pulls the ball back in, it once again threatened to hit the ropes, but AB is quick to pull it back in once again
10.5   Aravind to Nair, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Karun gets behind the line and defends it back towards the bowler
10.4   Aravind to Rahane, 1 run, short of a length and angling across Rahane, he doesn't get hold of the flat batted pull, just a single towards long-on
10.3   Aravind to Rahane, no run, the bouncer from Aravind, Rahane is very late on the pull and misses, the ball flies over the leg-stump
10.2   Aravind to Rahane, no run, on a length and angling across the right-hander, Rahane looks to play the flat-batted pull, mistimes it back towards the bowler
10.1   Aravind to Rahane, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, cramps Rahane for space, he jams it back towards the bowler
Sreenath Aravind [2.0-0-12-1] is back into the attack
9.6   Chahal to Nair, no run, slower and just outside off, Karun presses across and turns it towards mid-wicket

9.5   Chahal to Nair, FOUR, that's a lucky boundary for Karun, this was pushed through by Chahal, Karun was looking to dab it late, gets a thick edge past Karthik's gloves, beats short third man and races away to the fence
9.4   Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, pushed through by Chahal, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single
9.3   Chahal to Nair, 1 run, slower and just outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single

9.2   Chahal to Nair, no run, just short of Wiese at cover! This was flighted outside off, the wrong 'un from Chahal, Karun checked his drive and popped it towards cover, Wiese dives forward but the ball bounced in front of him
9.1   Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up and on Rahane's pads, nudged towards short fine leg for a single
8.6   Wiese to Nair, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Karun presses forward and defends it towards cover-point
A wide slip is in place, Gayle is the man there
8.5   Wiese to Nair, FOUR, that's much better! Too short from Wiese, back of a length and just outside off, Karun rocks back and pulls it powerfully over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
8.4   Wiese to Nair, no run, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Karun hangs his at that and is beaten on the outside edge, he isn't happy with himself as he walks away
8.3   Wiese to Rahane, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, Rahane plays with an open face and guides it behind point for a single
8.2   Wiese to Rahane, no run, on a good length and well outside off, Rahane lunges forward and defends it towards backward point
8.2   Wiese to Rahane, wide, Wiese goes for the slower off-cutter and slips it down leg-side, called as a wide
Karun Nair, right handed bat, comes to the crease

8.1   Wiese to S Smith, out Caught by de Villiers!! You know you are in trouble when AB is under the ball! That's another big blow for RAJ, Wiese kept it full and outside off as Smith rushed down the track, he was looking to go inside out over cover, the bat turned on impact and Smith ended up slicing it high and towards sweeper cover. AB had plenty of time to set himself underneath it and he accepts the gift. BLR are making big inroads into this RAJ batting line-up. S Smith c de Villiers b Wiese 12(13) [4s-1]
Wiese to S Smith, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
7.6   Chahal to S Smith, 1 run, Chahal drops this one short and just outside off, Smith rocks back and mistimes the pull towards deep mid-wicket, 5 runs from Chahal's first over
7.5   Chahal to S Smith, 2 runs, excellent cricket from Smith, comes down the track, covers for the spin and nudges it in front of mid-wicket, runs hard and gets back for the second run
7.4   Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up and just outside off, Rahane goes back and works it in front of square on the on-side for a single
7.3   Chahal to S Smith, 1 run, pushed through and just outside off, Smith rocks across and drags the pull towards long-on
7.2   Chahal to S Smith, no run, Chahal drops one slightly short and just outside off, Smith makes room and cuts it to the left of point
7.1   Chahal to S Smith, no run, pushed through by Chahal, Smith comes down the track and defends it off his pads
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Time for the strategic break

6.6   Wiese to Rahane, FOUR, cheeky and four, Wiese keeps it full and just outside off, Rahane prods forward, opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and runs it past the keeper. Karthik went full throttle with the dive, but the ball was always going past him
6.5   Wiese to S Smith, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, punched with a straight bat towards long-on
6.4   Wiese to Rahane, 1 run, another bouncer from Wiese, Rahane swivels across and horribly mistimes the pull, no one underneath it though, just a single towards mid-wicket
6.3   Wiese to S Smith, 1 run, short and way outside off, Smith reaches out and chops it square on the off-side for a single
6.2   Wiese to Rahane, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, nudged in front of square on the on-side for a single

6.1   Wiese to Rahane, 2 runs, short of a length and just outside off, Rahane rocked back and pulls it in front of square on the on-side. Starc gets across from the deep and sends in an accurate throw at the keeper, Rahane had to stretch and he does so
The third umpire has been called for a run-out chance. Rahane is well in though. Should be NOT OUT
David Wiese, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
5.6   Starc to S Smith, no run, full and wide from Starc, Smith leans into the cover drive, can't get it past Kohli at extra cover
5.5   Starc to S Smith, FOUR, lovely shot, overpitched and well outside off, almost a half-volley from Starc, Smith leans into the drive and goes over cover, one bounce and over the ropes
5.4   Starc to S Smith, no run, on a length and in that channel outside off, Smith gets behind the line and defends it towards the off-side
5.3   Starc to Rahane, 1 run, fuller length delivery and a hint of shape back into Rahane, he was prodding half-forward, gets an inside edge past leg-stump for a single
Starc isn't looking 100%, held his back after completing the delivery stride, BLR can't afford to lose their premier pacer
5.2   Starc to Rahane, no run, on a good length and a hint of shape back into Rahane, he prods forward and gets an inside edge onto the pads
5.1   Starc to S Smith, 1 run, fuller length delivery and well outside off, Smith leans forward and gets a thick edge on the drive, just a single to third man
Mitchell Starc [1.0-0-11-0] is back into the attack
4.6   Harshal Patel to S Smith, 1 run, width on offer from Harshal, Smith goes hard on the cut, goes to Aravind on the bounce at third man
Steven Smith, right handed bat, comes to the crease

4.5   Harshal Patel to Samson, out Caught by D Karthik!! Harshal is thrilled to bits, BLR have struck once again. This was banged in short and came back with the angle, Samson was looking to ramp it past the keeper. The ball got too big on him, he was completely cramped for room, he ended up looking ugly on the shot, ends up gloving it and Karthik gobbles it with delight. Samson c D Karthik b Harshal Patel 5(8)
Harshal Patel to Samson, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
4.4   Harshal Patel to Rahane, 1 run, fuller length delivery and just outside off, Rahane closes the face of the bat and drives it towards mid-on, just a single
4.3   Harshal Patel to Samson, 1 run, width on offer on this short of length delivery, Samson cuts it behind point, Aravind tidies up at square third man
4.2   Harshal Patel to Samson, no run, shortens the length, Samson takes a step out and punches it to mid-off
4.1   Harshal Patel to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahane was on the move as he knocks it to mid-on
3.6   Aravind to Samson, 2 runs, short of a length and just outside off, tucked in front of square on the on-side for a brace
3.5   Aravind to Samson, no run, much better from Aravind, on a good length and in that corridor outside off, Samson comes down the track and defends it towards point
3.4   Aravind to Rahane, 1 run, Aravind keeps it short and just outside off, Rahane looks to repeat the previous shot, ends up dragging it towards mid-on for a single
3.3   Aravind to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane is looking in good touch, fractionally short and just outside off, Rahane is quick to rock back and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary
3.2   Aravind to Samson, 1 run, on a length and angling across Samson, dabbed away towards third man for a single
3.1   Aravind to Rahane, 1 run, fuller length delivery and well outside off, Rahane reaches out for the drive, gets it off the toe-end and lobs it past Wiese at mid-off, just a single

2.6   Harshal Patel to Rahane, 1 run, width on offer from Harshal, Rahane went up and over point with the cut, there's AB at sweeper cover, Aravind gets across from third man, but the ball drops right in between them
2.5   Harshal Patel to Rahane, FOUR, lovely shot, too straight from Harshal, ends up angling onto Rahane's pads, he gets inside the line and clips it past mid-wicket, no need to run for those
2.4   Harshal Patel to Samson, 1 run, Harshal shortened his length as Samson took a step down the track, worked in front of Starc at mid-wicket for a single

2.3   Harshal Patel to Samson, no run, fuller length delivery and in that corridor outside off, Samson leans forward, plays with an open face and guides it to the right of backward point. Mandeep dives and saves some runs
2.2   Harshal Patel to Rahane, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, Rahane prods across and nudges it in front of mid-on for a single
2.1   Harshal Patel to Rahane, no run, on a good length and in that channel outside off, hardly bounced as well, Rahane pushed away from his body and is beaten
Harshal Patel, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Sanju Samson, right handed bat, comes to the crease

1.6   Aravind to Watson, out Caught by D Karthik!! Aravind has struck! That's a huge blow for RAJ, Watson shakes his head as he walked away. This was short and angled across the right-hander, Watson went chasing after that, was there a nick on that? Karthik moved across to his right and started celebrating as soon as he took the catch, Gayle at first slip was keen as well. Replays suggest that there was a noise as the ball went past the bat. Kohli is thrilled to bits, so is the BLR camp. Watson c D Karthik b Aravind 10(5) [4s-2]
Aravind to Watson, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
1.5   Aravind to Rahane, 1 run, fuller length delivery and in that channel outside off, Rahane leans forward and drives it to the left of mid-off. Wiese tumbles and keeps them down to a single
1.4   Aravind to Watson, 1 run, width on offer from Aravind, Watson leans back and cuts it up and over cover. AB is in the deep at sweeper, just a single for Watson
1.3   Aravind to Rahane, 1 run, tad fuller and a hint of nip back into Rahane, tucked away to the right of mid-on for a single
1.2   Aravind to Rahane, no run, Aravind shortens his length and angles one across the right-hander, Rahane went chasing after that and is beaten
1.1   Aravind to Rahane, no run, short of a length and angling into Rahane, he shuffled across on the clip, misses and is struck high on the hips, he wanted a run and is sent back by his partner
Sreenath Aravind, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
0.6   Starc to Rahane, 1 run, tad fuller and shaping away from off, Rahane plays well in front of his body, gets an inside edge towards square leg, Watson calls him through for a quick single
0.5   Starc to Rahane, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Rahane leans forward and defends it with an angled bat towards backward point
Starc hasn't pitched up even one ball so far, testing the middle of the pitch
0.4   Starc to Watson, 1 run, short of a length and angling across Watson, steered away towards third man for a single
0.3   Starc to Watson, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Watson, back of a length and on Watson's pads, he gets inside the line and clips it behind square on the on-side

0.2   Starc to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width from Starc, it was short as well, Watson leans onto the back foot and cracks it square on the off-side, it was in the air but bisected the two men at point and cover-point
0.1   Starc to Rahane, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, that got big on Rahane, he does well to play with soft hands and fends it behind square on the off-side for a single
Rahane and Watson are at the crease. Rahane is on strike. Starc will open the attack
A slip in place as Starc steams in

Welcome back. Virat Kohli leads the BLR huddle. Can RAJ chase down 181? A lot will depend on their openers, Rahane and Watson. 181 has never been chased down on this ground. So it's advantage BLR as we start the chase..

Kulkarni: "The main thing was to stick to the basics on this wicket and that's what I did. It was important to bowl the proper areas and not give freebies. I just want to back my strengths. Yes, we can chase this down."

In the 15th over, de Villiers used the crease superbly to put the spinner, Ankit Sharma, to the sword. He then went on to land crucial blows off Chris Morris' bowling to crack two sixes in the 18th over and reached his fifty. At the other end, Mandeep Singh too checked in a series of fine shots and essayed a half-century. RAJ would rue the fact that they lost their way in the slog overs.

AB de Villiers and Mandeep Singh's crunching knocks lifted BLR to a good total. In fact, RAJ's bowlers bowled with unrelenting control up front to keep the lid on the scoring rate. Dhawal Kulkarni proved his worth by bowling with good discipline to snare the key wickets of Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli. However, in the nick of time, de Villiers explored every nook and cranny of the ground to up the ante.

19.6   C Morris to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, that's a nasty ball from Morris. Pacy bumper on the stumps, Mandeep misses the pull, the ball pops in the air off the helmet, Morris takes the catch but there was no bat/glove involved. Rahane goes up to Mandeep Singh and congratulates him for his wonderful innings
19.5   C Morris to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, Morris follows Sarfaraz as he backs away, the batsman mistimes the pull to long-on
19.4   C Morris to Mandeep, 1 run, yorker length delivery outside off stump, Mandeep squeezes it out to point
Sarfaraz Khan, right handed bat, comes to the crease

19.3   C Morris to D Karthik, out Caught by Rahane!! The toe-end of the bat without the bottom hand grip and it's an easy catch to long-off. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Karthik tries to flat-bat it over the bowler's head, but doesn't get it right, long-off moves forward and takes it. D Karthik c Rahane b C Morris 8(3) [6s-1]
C Morris to D Karthik, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
19.2   C Morris to D Karthik, 2 runs, almost a yorker, Karthik whips it to deep mid-wicket
19.1   C Morris to D Karthik, SIX, low full toss and just a flick of the wrists, the ball goes over deep backward square leg. Morris not happy with himself for missing his mark

18.6   Faulkner to Mandeep, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Mandeep. Fullish and just outside off stump, with third man inside the ring, Mandeep just opens the face of the bat at the last moment and dabs it fine for four. Fifty for Mandeep and Karthik pats him on the head. This has been an excellent knock from Mandeep

18.5   Faulkner to Mandeep, SIX, gee! What a shot! Faulkner just missed his length by an inch or so. Mandeep goes deep in the crease and also clears his right leg out of the way, slogs it hard and clears deep mid-wicket
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease

18.4   Faulkner to Mandeep, out de Villiers Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is good bowling. Faulkner is not allowing the batsman to get under the ball by bowling a very full length, Mandeep mistimes the drive to long-on, they try to steal two but Binny runs to his left from long-on and fires a fine throw, Faulkner takes the bails off to catch AB de Villiers well short. End of a fabulous innings from the South African. de Villiers run out (Binny/Faulkner) 66(38) [4s-4 6s-4]
Faulkner to Mandeep, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!
Third umpire called for a run-out check. AB is walking and he's well short.
18.3   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, can't get under those, again almost a yorker, drilled to long-off
18.2   Faulkner to de Villiers, 2 runs, almost a yorker, de Villiers drills it to long-on, Mandy quickly races back for the second to keep de Villiers on strike
18.1   Faulkner to Mandeep, 1 run, slower delivery from Faulkner, Mandeep tries to muscle it hard but hits it on the bounce to long-on
James Faulkner [3.0-0-27-0] is back into the attack

17.6   C Morris to de Villiers, 2 runn, oh this should have gone out of the ground as well, again a juicy full ball, de Villiers mistimes the slog to long-on. 17 runs off the over, a great one for BLR

17.5   C Morris to de Villiers, SIX, easy ball and AB will not miss out on those. Full and on the stumps, de Villiers takes his front leg out of the way and smashes it high and over wide long-on to move into the 60s

17.4   C Morris to de Villiers, SIX, top edge but it's gone all the way. A fine fifty from de Villiers! What a timely knock. Shortish and on the leg stump, de Villiers gets inside the line and tries to help it on its way, gets a thick edge and it flies over fine leg. AB crosses 500 runs this season. Just a gentle raise of the bat to the crowd and his team-mates to acknowledge the applause
17.3   C Morris to Mandeep, 1 run, very full, Mandeep mistimes the drive to long-on

17.2   C Morris to Mandeep, 2 runs, short of length delivery hurrying onto the batsman, Mandeep inside-edges the pull through backward square leg, returns for the second, luckily for him the throw was wide and Samson had to stretch to his left and then whip the bails off
Third umpire has been called for a run-out check. Mandy is the man in question, but he's well home.
17.1   C Morris to Mandeep, no run, full and in the slot, Mandeep swings and misses. That could have easily gone into the stands, but Morris gets away with it
Chris Morris [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
16.6   Watson to Mandeep, 1 run, widish full ball, Mandy targets extra-cover with the drive but the ball goes off the inside half of the bat and rolls to mid-on
16.5   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, low full toss, de Villiers should have done better with it, driven hard but Smith dives to his left at mid-off and saves three runs once again

16.4   Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs, leading edge but there is no one at deep point to take it. Full ball from Watson, de Villiers tries to go leg-side, the ball flies over backward point and Karun Nair tidies up in the deep
16.4   Watson to de Villiers, wide, this is the fourth wide that Watson has bowled tonight. That's cruel from a senior pro. Way outside off stump, Samson fumbles but they don't take a run

16.3   Watson to de Villiers, FOUR, edgedddd and just past Samson. Slower delivery from Watson, de Villiers backs away and looks to cut, gets a thick edge, Samson jumps high and tries to grab it with his right hand but the ball escapes
16.2   Watson to de Villiers, no run, yorker length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers tries to drill it through the off-side but only manages to dig it back to the bowler

16.1   Watson to de Villiers, FOUR, in the slot and bannggggg. Even a full length dive from the man at extra-cover wasn't good enough. Full and outside off stump, de Villiers crashes the drive between extra-cover and mid-off to begin the over in style
Shane Watson [3.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
15.6   Faulkner to Mandeep, no run, short of length delivery following the batsman, Mandeep mistimes it back to the bowler

15.5   Faulkner to Mandeep, FOUR, excellent batting. Looks like he's having the field map in his brain. Knew that third man was inside the ring, as Faulkner offered a freebie that was short and outside off stump, Mandeep gives himself a bit of room and guides it over short third man

15.4   Faulkner to Mandeep, no run, beaten! Faulkner angles this short of length delivery back into the right-hander and cramps him for room, Mandeep plays an ugly looking pull shot and the ball goes just over the leg stump

15.3   Faulkner to Mandeep, FOUR, Mandeep Singh is playing a great knock. Faulkner goes round the wicket and bowls a full ball, Mandeep steps out, gets down low and lofts the drive inside-out over extra-cover for four
15.2   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, good length delivery on the leg stump, de Villiers flicks it to deep mid-wicket, this time he hit it too well and there was no chance of a second run

15.1   Faulkner to de Villiers, 2 runs, good length delivery on the leg stump, de Villiers turns it into the vacant mid-wicket region, the call was for two and Mandeep responded well and put in the dive to make his ground. It wasn't a direct-hit though
James Faulkner [2.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack

Time-out. These two have steadied the innings nicely. With five more overs to go and both batsmen well set, BLR would be looking for 50-60 more. The Rajasthan need to get AB early, otherwise they could be chasing well above 180.
14.6   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, flatter delivery on the leg stump, de Villiers softly punches it to long-on and keeps strike

14.5   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, this is turning out to be a great over for BLR and chants of "AB, AB, AB" is doing the rounds at the grounds. Ankit Sharma tries to bowl a widish full ball, de Villiers reads it early, reaches out and smashes the drive hard and to the right of extra-cover

14.4   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, in the airrrrrr and just over the man at deep mid-wicket, this time to his right. Rahane jumps high but the ball evades him. On the leg stump, another slog-sweep, not much of elevation but enough distance on it
14.3   Ankit Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, taps this towards cover-point and sets off
14.2   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, fired full and outside off stump, de Villiers drills it to long-off

14.1   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, flatter delivery on the leg stump, de Villiers quickly gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it hard, the timing was very good as it cleared the man at deep mid-wicket. Fifty partnership comes up as well

13.6   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, inside-edge onto the pad, late call for a quick single, but Mandy makes his ground. de Villiers plays across the line and gets an inside edge onto pad, the ball rolls towards silly-point, Mandy calls for a run and de Villiers responds
13.6   Watson to de Villiers, wide, got to rebowl that, low full toss outside off stump, Watson lost his radar on that occasion
13.5   Watson to de Villiers, no run, Watson is still able to get some swing in the 14th over. Outswinger outside off stump, a swing and a miss from de Villiers
13.4   Watson to Mandeep, 1 run, coming into the right-hander and cramping him for room, Mandeep tucks it to backward square leg
13.4   Watson to Mandeep, wide, that's way outside off stump, Mandeep fails to get bat on ball despite reaching out, called a wide
13.3   Watson to de Villiers, leg byes, 1 run, optimistic shout for LBW from Watto, de Villiers walks across the stumps and tries to sweep, misses and is struck well outside off stump
13.2   Watson to Mandeep, 1 run, the inswinger on a fuller length, driven nicely off the front foot, but Smith runs to his left at mid-off, dives and saves three
13.1   Watson to Mandeep, no run, late movement away from the right-hander on this good length delivery, Mandeep handles it off the back foot
Shane Watson [2.0-0-14-0] is back into the attack

12.6   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, no run, that is an excellent one-handed save from Ankit Sharma. AB advances and drills this flighted delivery very hard, the bowler gets down low to his left and stops the ball. This is interesting, the Rajasthan appeal for a catch. Oh dear! That was a bump ball. The bowler did not appeal, not sure who did. It fell a foot short of Ankit Sharma
12.5   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, no run, de Villiers lets it go thinking it was a wide, but it was inside the line
12.4   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, no run, no flight whatsoever on this flatter ball, de Villiers punches it to the left of the bowler
12.3   Ankit Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, width on offer outside off stump, cut to deep point
12.2   Ankit Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, uppish but safe. Flighted delivery just outside off stump, Mandeep gets down on one knee and sweeps, sends it past Faulkner at 45 and it raced away

12.1   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, Ankit Sharma is very lucky that de Villiers didn't place this perfectly in the gap. Full and way outside off stump, de Villiers reaches out and drives very hard, the man at sweeper moves to his right and saves three
Ankit Sharma [1.0-0-3-0] is back into the attack
BLR gaining a bit of momentum, they have scored 35 runs in the last three overs.
11.6   Faulkner to Mandeep, FOUR, short and asking for trouble, Mandy goes on the back foot and pulls it nicely over the infield, clears mid-wicket and the fielder in the deep had no chance
11.5   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, de Villiers advances and flicks it to mid-wicket
11.4   Faulkner to Mandeep, 1 run, back of the hand slower ball, Mandeep looks to dab, the ball bounces extra and hits the splice of the bat before rolling towards third man
11.3   Faulkner to de Villiers, 1 run, waits for the length ball to come and guides it to third man
11.2   Faulkner to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, fullish and down the leg-side, a fine little tickle would have been four, but Mandeep misses the glance and it rolls off the pad to the left of the keeper

11.1   Faulkner to Mandeep, FOUR, top shot sir! Faulkner has to prove his reputation right. He has been poor for most of the season and the Rajasthan need him to deliver tonight in this crunch game. Short ball angling away from the right-hander, Mandeep upper-cuts it nicely over backward point and it bounces just inside the rope
James Faulkner [1.0-0-5-0] is back into the attack
10.6   Watson to de Villiers, no run, the inswinger to round off the over, de Villiers defends it nicely from the crease
10.5   Watson to Mandeep, 1 run, good length delivery outside off stump, Mandeep guides it down to third man
10.4   Watson to de Villiers, 1 run, down the track again to Watson, but de Villiers mistimes this and it rolls towards long-on

10.3   Watson to de Villiers, FOUR, that's a classy hit from the master. Not a bad ball at all. In fact many batsmen would have been foxed by the late outswing on this one, but de Villiers allows the ball to come, watches it nicely onto the bat and guides it fine past the fielder at slip to beat third man

10.2   Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs, in the airrrr but over the man at mid-off. AB raced down the track to loft it over the infield, mistimed the length ball completely, but luckily for him the man was inside the ring
10.1   Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs, back of a length just outside off, de Villiers takes a step out of the crease, punches it square of the wicket on the off-side for a brace
Shane Watson [1.0-0-4-0] is back into the attack

9.6   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep spoils Kulkarni's figures with those two shots. This has to be the best shot of the innings. Fullish and just outside off, Mandeep gets underneath that and lofts it handsomely over long-off for a maximum. Kulkarni finishes with: 4-0-28-2

9.5   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, FOUR, fraction short and Kulkarni is hit for four. A much needed boundary for BLR. The pressure was mounting and Mandeep releases some of it. He goes back and brings those fast hands into play, pulls it to the deep mid-wicket fence
9.4   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, no run, back of a length just outside off, Mandeep guides it to backward point, Jinks stops it with his left hand
This is the slowest 50 for BLR in this year's IPL.
9.3   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, on a length close to off, de Villiers waits for the ball to arrive before dabbing it to third man

9.2   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, 1 run, that's a risky single. Taking on Smith is not the smartest thing to do. Mandeep charges down and drives it to mid-off, Smith gets around quickly and fires to the striker's end, misses as ABD gets in
9.1   D Kulkarni to de Villiers, 1 run, good length ball on the stumps, de Villiers stays behind the line and knocks it in front of mid-on
Kulkarni to bowl out. He has already got Gayle and Virat, can he nip out ABD as well?

8.6   Binny to Mandeep, no run, beauty! Back of a length in the corridor around off, Mandeep shuffles across and looks to defend, the ball shapes away enough to beat the outside edge. End of another good over
8.5   Binny to Mandeep, no run, short and moving away outside off, Mandeep reaches out and can't connect with the cut, that was too close to being called a wide. Binny might have got away with one
8.4   Binny to de Villiers, 1 run, Binny goes wide of the crease and keeps it short of length, bit of extra bounce which AB handles well, gets on top of it and runs it to third man
8.3   Binny to de Villiers, no run, back of a length around off, de Villiers hangs back and punches it gently to cover
8.2   Binny to de Villiers, no run, rush of blood from ABD. Gives the charge to Binny and looks to pull, the ball keeps a tad low and sneaks through under his bat
8.1   Binny to de Villiers, no run, back of a length outside off, de Villiers dabs it on the bounce to the keeper. Don't know why he would play that shot as there is a slip in place
Stuart Binny, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
7.6   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, no run, angling in on middle and leg, Mandeep turns it to the right of mid-wicket, wanted the run but AB says no
7.5   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, no run, once again the ball is not coming onto the bat, short of length outside off, Mandeep mistimes the punch towards cover
7.4   D Kulkarni to Mandeep, no run, good length ball just outside off, Mandeep covers the line, lifts his bat and lets it go
Mandeep Singh, right handed bat, comes to the crease

7.3   D Kulkarni to Kohli, out Caught&Bowled!! Kulkarni is turning it on for RAJ. He has got his second in as many overs. Kohli tells AB something before making his way back. Back of a length and holds its line, the ball also stopped on him, Kohli checks his shot and lobs it to the left of the bowler, Kulkarni accepts it gleefully. BLR in trouble now. Kohli c and b D Kulkarni 12(18)
D Kulkarni to Kohli, THATS OUT!! Caught&Bowled!!
7.2   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 2 runs, back of a length on off, Kohli works it in front of deep mid-wicket, called for two and AB responds
7.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, short of length outside off, Kohli shimmies down the wicket, wanted to go inside out, the extra bounce beats the outside edge

6.6   Ankit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, Ankit expected Kohli to come down the track, darts it outside off, Kohli was almost outdone there, he just about manages to reach it and squirt it to the left of cover
6.5   Ankit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, tossed up outside off, de Villiers leans forward and eases the drive to the left of sweeper cover
6.4   Ankit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, pushed through on the stumps, Kohli goes back and works it in front of square on the leg-side
6.3   Ankit Sharma to Kohli, no run, fired in full and outside off, Kohli reaches out and slices it to backward point. That would have been called a wide, had he let it go
A slip in place..
6.2   Ankit Sharma to Kohli, no run, flatter and on leg-stump, Kohli misses the nudge, wears it on the pad
6.1   Ankit Sharma to Kohli, no run, flighted on the stumps, Kohli presses forward and defends to cover
Ankit Sharma, left-arm orthodox, comes into the attack
AB de Villiers, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Time-out. Kohli after taking the single off the 5th ball signalled to Gayle that RAJ have asked for a time-out after the end of the over. Even after knowing that, Gayle went for the big hit and threw his wicket away.

5.6   D Kulkarni to Gayle, out Bowled!! Kulkarni has struck with the last ball of the powerplay. It is a big wicket for RAJ as Gayle trudges off the field. He keeps it simple, bowls it on a length even as Gayle advances, the Jamaican misses the heave to the leg-side and the ball hits the top of middle stump. A needless shot from the big man, but RAJ would be delighted to see the back of him. Gayle b D Kulkarni 27(26) [4s-4 6s-1]
D Kulkarni to Gayle, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
5.5   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Kohli gets well forward, opens the bat face and runs it to square third man
5.4   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, fullish and close to off, Kohli presses forward and knocks it back to the bowler
5.3   D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, short of length around off, Kohli defends solidly off the back foot

5.2   D Kulkarni to Gayle, 1 run, Gayle gets lucky there. Again, Kulkarni keeps it back of a length, Gayle wanted to go over long-on, goes back and mistimes the loft, the mid-on fielder would have gobbled that up, but Faulkner was on the rope
5.1   D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, steered down to third man with an angled bat
Dhawal Kulkarni [1.0-0-10-0] is back into the attack
4.6   C Morris to Gayle, no run, that's a mighty swing from the Jamaican. Good length ball around off, Gayle winds up to target the cow corner fence, misses it by a few inches
4.5   C Morris to Gayle, no run, fuller and angling in, Gayle turns it gently towards short mid-wicket

4.4   C Morris to Gayle, FOUR, corker of a delivery. It didn't deserve four. Inswinging yorker, ends up being a low full toss, it was heading for the base of middle stump, Gayle gets his front leg out of the way, squirts it off the inside part of the bat, beats short fine to his left
4.3   C Morris to Gayle, no run, nice line and length from Morris, in the channel just outside off on a fuller length, Gayle thought about playing that before lifting his bat and letting it go
4.3   C Morris to Gayle, wide, slips it down leg, Gayle doesn't get any wood on that as another extra added to the BLR total

Some problem with the ball. The umpires are having a look. Meanwhile, the batsmen are having a drink. In fact, they have asked for a replacement. All set for the action to resume. Morris switches to round the wicket...

4.2   C Morris to Gayle, FOUR, thumped! That ball reached the rope at the rate of knots. Gayle was waiting for the short ball, he pulls it in front of square, wide of mid-wicket and picks up four more
4.1   C Morris to Kohli, 1 run, short of length on the fourth stump line, Kohli stays back and glides it to third man
Chris Morris [1.0-0-5-0] is back into the attack

3.6   Watson to Gayle, no run, hint of inward movement for Watto, Gayle was shaping up to play the big shot, he just about brings his bat down in time and jams it onto the pad, the ball rolls to the left of Watson
3.6   Watson to Gayle, wide, splays it down leg, Gayle shuffles across and can't connect with the glance, good take by Samson diving to his right
3.5   Watson to Kohli, 1 run, short and width on offer, Kohli goes after that, doesn't get it off the middle as the ball rolls away to third man
3.4   Watson to Gayle, 1 run, short and on the hips, tucked away square of the wicket on the leg-side, for a single
3.3   Watson to Gayle, no run, fuller and on off, Gayle camps on the back foot and pushes it to mid-on
3.2   Watson to Kohli, 1 run, short of length on off, Kohli moves across and knocks it in front of mid-on, quick single taken. Good response from Gayle

3.1   Watson to Kohli, no run, back of a length outside off, bit of seam movement for Watto, Kohli walks across his stumps and pokes at it and is beaten. No carry on this one, goes on the bounce to the keeper
Shane Watson, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

2.6   D Kulkarni to Gayle, byes, FOUR, as expected the bowler bowls a bouncer after being hit for a six, Gayle takes it on and fails to lay bat on that, the ball does a bit too much and sails over the leaping Samson. Bonus runs for BLR

2.5   D Kulkarni to Gayle, SIX, Rameez Raja on air says it's a baby six. Length delivery just outside off, Gayle clears his front leg and swings through the line, gets enough wood for the ball to clear the long-on fence
2.4   D Kulkarni to Gayle, no run, Gayle stays back for this short of length delivery and taps it to the off-side

2.3   D Kulkarni to Gayle, no run, loose shot from Gayle, gives the charge to Kulkarni, goes for a big swing through the line, misses and the ball beats the outside edge. Good carry through to Samson, who takes it head height
2.2   D Kulkarni to Gayle, no run, shortens the length around off, Gayle shuffles across, is cramped for room as he mistimes the pull towards mid-on

2.1   D Kulkarni to Gayle, FOUR, crunched! Back of a length outside off, Gayle frees his arms and smacks it in the air, it was up for sometime, but well wide of Smith at mid-off. That was hit with some power as it raced away to the fence
Dhawal Kulkarni, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
1.6   Faulkner to Kohli, 2 runs, fullish and just outside off, Kohli leans forward and eases it past cover, hits the gap and picks up two before Smith hunts it down from mid-off

1.5   Faulkner to Gayle, 1 run, run-out chance missed! Gayle was gone by a long way. Too straight, on middle and leg, Gayle gets inside the line and nurdles it to fine leg, the fielder was square and had to get a long way, Binny throws to Samson near the striker's end, Gayle was haring down for the second before being sent back, Samson fires at the bowler's end and misses. Gayle was not even in the picture. Faulkner should have got back and collected the throw
1.4   Faulkner to Gayle, no run, keeps it tight around off, Gayle gets nicely behind the line and knocks it to backward point
1.3   Faulkner to Kohli, 1 run, on a length around off, Kohli is not fully forward, plays with an angled bat, the ball takes the outer half and rolls down to third man
1.2   Faulkner to Gayle, 1 run, shortens the length outside off, Gayle looks to force it off the back foot, the thickish outside edge goes on the bounce to third man

1.1   Faulkner to Gayle, no run, back of a length just outside off, Gayle hangs on the back foot and thumps it towards mid-off, Smith gets quickly across to his left and makes a half stop, enough to save the single from being taken
James Faulkner, comes into the attack
0.6   C Morris to Gayle, 1 run, ends the over with a slower one, off-cutter outside off, Gayle waits for the ball to arrive and steers it to third man

0.5   C Morris to Gayle, no run, short of length around off, Gayle plays the short-arm pull, no timing on that as he hits it back to the bowler, Morris tries to fire a throw without collecting the ball

0.4   C Morris to Gayle, no run, the stumps at the bowler's end denies Gayle some runs, pitched up just outside off, Gayle mistimes the drive straight down the wicket, the ball hits timber. Had Morris got a hand, Kohli would have been in trouble
0.3   C Morris to Gayle, no run, back of a length and angled across the left-hander, Gayle watches it carefully and lets it go

0.2   C Morris to Gayle, FOUR, cracking shot! A long half volley from Morris, well wide of off, Gayle uses his reach to connect, pierces the off-side field, beats mid-off to his right and picks up his first boundary

0.1   C Morris to Gayle, no run, right off the meat of the bat, full and swinging back into the batsman, Gayle leans forward and flicks it towards mid-wicket, Nair dives to his right and makes a fine stop. He saved some runs there
Gayle and Kohli are at the crease. Gayle is on strike. C Morris will open the attack
The countdown is done and dusted. Morris to start things off. He has a slip in place. Here we go...

We are all set for the Eliminator to begin. A place in Qualifier 2 is on the line. The umpires make their way out to the middle. Kohli was on his knees in deep concentration before striding out with Gayle. The Rajasthan are already in the field. Gayle makes his customary ritual, stands midway down the wicket and has a look at the wicket.
Teams:
Rajasthan (Playing XI): Ajinkya Rahane, Shane Watson, Steven Smith(c), Sanju Samson(w), Karun Nair, Deepak Hooda, James Faulkner, Stuart Binny, Chris Morris, Ankit Sharma, Dhawal Kulkarni
Bangalore (Playing XI): Virat Kohli(c), Chris Gayle, AB de Villiers, Mandeep Singh, Dinesh Karthik(w), Sarfaraz Khan, David Wiese, Mitchell Starc, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Sreenath Aravind
Bangalore have won the toss and have opted to bat

Smith: "We are in the Eliminator, so we have to play our best cricket tonight. There is a bit of grass on this surface, looks a bit different as well. We've got to bowl well now, restrict them and try and chase it down. Ankit Sharma is in for Brainder Sran."

Kohli: "We are privileged to be here than nervous. The rain has been following us. We got important points because of the rain. We also lost the second spot because of the rain in Bangalore, but that's all past and we've got to play well today. We will bat first, looks like a nice hard surface with an even covering of grass. Sreenath Aravind comes back for Ashok Dinda."
Weather report: There is absolutely no chance of rain and the temperatures are expected to hover in the late 20s, which should be ideal for cricket.

Team news: If fully fit, BLR could include Sreenath Aravind in place of Ashok Dinda, while the rest of the line-up is expected to stay the same. Meanwhile, RAJ have always been a team which has given opportunities to youngsters. We saw Brainder Sran made his IPL debut the other day, but for this crucial encounter, will they go back to Pravin Tambe? We'll find out soon at the toss.

Ajinkya Rahane has been the top run-getter for the side. He has combined well with skipper Shane Watson and provided many good starts for the Rajasthan. Steve Smith & Co. would want the Indian youngsters in the side to pull up their socks and do well in this crunch game as they have not been that consistent in the second half of the tournament. Since Watson's entry into the side, the runs have not been flowing off Smith's bat, which is a big area of concern for RAJ. With the ball, Chris Morris has been consistent throughout the season, but James Faulkner has not lived up to his reputation. Overall, RAJ will have to be on top of their game if they are to beat a formidable BLR outfit.

Moving focus to Rajasthan, things did not go according to plan after a dream start to the season. With five wins out of five games, the Rajasthan were all set to become the first team to seal a playoff spot, but they managed to win just two games in their next nine. However, it has to be taken into account that two of their games were ruined by rain. In fact, the last encounter against KOL was a do-or-die affair, which the Rajasthan managed to win.

Ever since the return of Mitchell Starc, the bowling, which has been BLR's weaklink over the years, has looked stronger. While Yuzvendra Chahal continues to impress with his leggies, Harshal Patel has quietly gone about his business and given vital breakthroughs for Kohli. However, BLR have not been able to find a solid performer for the last spot in the side. Varun Aaron, Iqbal Abdulla, Abu Nechim and Ashok Dinda have all been tried, but all four have blown hot and cold. Just when it looked like Sreenath Aravind was their answer, he got injured.

The move to pack Chris Gayle, Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers at the top has worked wonders for the Bangalore. Mandeep Singh and Sarfaraz Khan have showcased their talent in a few games, but BLR would want them to deliver the goods on a consistent basis. The form of Dinesh Karthik is the only concern for them with the bat, but the top-order has generally done well to negate the flaw. The fact that David Wiese, who comes to bat lower down the order, has not been needed to do much gives a clear picture that the runs have been flowing at the top.

AB de Villiers and Mandeep Singh's crunching knocks lifted BLR to a good total. In fact, RAJ's bowlers bowled with unrelenting control up front to keep the lid on the scoring rate. Dhawal Kulkarni proved his worth by bowling with good discipline to snare the key wickets of Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli. However, in the nick of time, de Villiers explored every nook and cranny of the ground to up the ante.

Preview:.
As the business end of the 2015 Indian Premier League approached, Rajasthan started to slump while Bangalore build good momentum that helped them to the second position in the points tally for a brief while. RAJ, however, made it to the play-offs winning a must-win encounter in their final league game, while BLR were denied a place in Qualifier 1 by the rain gods, and when the two teams clash in Pune for a place in Qualifier 2, there is no doubt who will start as the favourites.

Despite boasting an enviable batting line-up and a bowling unit led by the in-form Mitchell Starc, BLR would be well aware that the inaugural IPL champions and the tournament's perennial underdogs, Rajasthan, are not to be taken lightly.

Venue: Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune
Date: May 20, 2015
Time: 20:00 IST
Weather: Bright and sunny with a high of 33 degree Celsius

Team News

Bangalore

Talk about peaking at the right time and with the likes of Chris Gayle, Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers scoring runs at will, BLR would not even think of tinkering with their batting line-up despite the poor run of form of Dinesh Karthik. Gayle, Kohli and de Villiers are among the top run-getters in the tournament and it will be tough for RAJ took overcome BLR if the trio fire. Ashok Dinda, who was given a chance in the last two league games failed to impress and in all likelihood the Bengal pacer will be replaced by Varun Aaron or Sreenath Aravind, provided Aravind recovers from his finger injury.

Probable XI: 1. Chris Gayle, 2. Virat Kohli (captain), 3. AB de Villiers, 4. Dinesh Karthik (wicketkeeper), 5. Mandeep Singh, 6. Sarfaraz Khan, 7. David Wiese, 8. Mitchell Starc, 9. Harshal Patel, 10. Varun Aaron/Sreenath Aravind, 11. Yuzvendra Chahal.

Rajasthan

The return to form of Shane Watson, who helped RAJ book a place in play-offs with a scintillating 104 against Kolkata, has boosted the Jaipur-based franchise and along with Ajinkya Rahane, who is the second highest run-getter in the tournament so far, RAJ does have a top-order that can overcomethe threat of a certain Mitchell Starc. RAJ have been known to surprise their opponents and have been bold enough to change the combination for crucial games. Brainder Sran, who made his debut for RAJ in against KOL will in all likelihood willsit out in place of Pravin Tambe. Their chances of containing the powerful BLR batting unit will depend on the wily Chris Morris.

Probable XI: 1. Ajinkya Rahane, 2. Shane Watson, 3. Steven Smith (captain), 4. Sanju Samson (wicketkeeper), 5. James Faulkner, 6. Karun Nair, 7. Chris Morris, 8. Deepak Hooda, 9. Stuart Binny, 10. Dhawal Kulkarni, 11. Pravin Tambe.

Stats and Trivia

Both teams have played each other 14 times in IPL with Rajasthan and Bangalore winning seven each. The last encounter between the two was washed out.

Quotes

"A lot of the teams rely on their big stars to deliver. We believe we are a balanced side and don't necessarily rely on one or two individuals. We do have some stars and if they perform and win matches on their own, it's great," Rajsthan Rajasthan mentor, Rahul Dravid.
Teams:

Rajasthan (From): Shane Watson(c), Ajinkya Rahane, Steven Smith, Sanju Samson(w), Karun Nair, Deepak Hooda, James Faulkner, Stuart Binny, Chris Morris, Dhawal Kulkarni, Brainder Sran, Rajat Bhatia, Pravin Tambe, Abhishek Nayar, Ben Cutting, Dishant Yagnik, Vikramjeet Malik, Ankit Sharma, Rahul Tewatia, Dinesh Salunkhe, Rusty Theron, Pardeep Sahu, Sagar Trivedi

Bangalore (From): Virat Kohli(c), Chris Gayle, AB de Villiers, Mandeep Singh, Dinesh Karthik(w), Sarfaraz Khan, David Wiese, Harshal Patel, Mitchell Starc, Ashok Dinda, Yuzvendra Chahal, Sreenath Aravind, Abu Nechim, Varun Aaron, Nic Maddinson, Vijay Zol, Sandeep Warrier, Yogesh Takawale, Rilee Rossouw, Iqbal Abdulla, Manvinder Bisla, S Badrinath, Darren Sammy, Sean Abbott, Jalaj Saxena, Shishir Bhavane
